CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1941, pg. 3, reads: "Typical Participants in Hill Playgrounds - In an attempt to combat the evils of poor housing, etc., such as juvenile delinquency and petty offenses, the Board of Education has embarked on an enlarged playground program in Hill which is meeting with huge success. Although parental and older girl cooperation is not so large as is desired, the children are highly enthusiastic about the varied activities.  Above are shown some of the leaders and children from the various sections. Back row, from left to right are: Michael Dadasovich, John Brewer, Pomeroyal Fountain, Marion Staunton, and John Morton.  They meet, regularly to discuss their problems.  In the front row are Bobby Anderson, J. Morsee, Peggy Carter, Marvin Richter, Lois Roll, Eloise Clark, Eugene Gelter. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of leaders and participants in Hill District playground program, back row from left: Michael Dadasovich, John Brewer Sr., Pomeroyal Fountain, Marion Staunton, John Morton; front row: Bobby Anderson, J. Morsee, Peggy Carter, Marvin Richter, Lois Roll, Eloise Clark, and Eugene Gelter
